𝐍𝐄𝐏 𝐯𝐬 𝐓𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐥 𝐍𝐚𝐝𝐮'𝐬 𝐒𝐄𝐏: 𝐊𝐞𝐲 𝐝𝐢𝐟𝐟𝐞𝐫𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞𝐬 𝐢𝐧 𝐞𝐱𝐚𝐦𝐬, 𝐥𝐚𝐧𝐠𝐮𝐚𝐠𝐞, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐚𝐝𝐦𝐢𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬

Tamil Nadu has launched its very own State Education Policy (SEP), and it’s a straight-up rejection of the National Education Policy (NEP) brought in by the Centre. Chief Minister 
@mkstalin
  unveiled the new policy with a clear message -- education in Tamil Nadu will follow its own path.

The Tamil Nadu SEP was drafted by a 14-member panel led by Justice Murugesan. The policy rejects key NEP provisions, retains the two-language policy, and prioritises science, AI, and English.

So what’s different between the NEP and SEP? Here’s a section-by-section breakdown:
 Language policy
 School examination system
 UG college admissions
 Position on neet and central exams
 Control of education Education focus area
 Political stand and funding approach
